item.title: Silvana add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The smallest feline is a masterpiece." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Everyone loves a conspiracy." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "As you cannot do what you want, Want what you can do" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I don't know anything with certainty, but seeing the stars makes me dream." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is with the reading of books the same as with looking at pictures; one must, without doubt, without hesitations, with assurance, admire what is beautiful." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I'm such a nobody." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description:
"On some positions, cowardice asks the question, is it expedient? And then expedience comes along and asks the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular? Conscience asks the question, is it right?
There comes a time when one must take the position that is neither safe nor politic nor popular, but he must do it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Silvana add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "Soul mates' are fiction and an illusion; and while every young man and young woman will seek with all diligence and prayerfulness to find a mate with whom life can be most compatible and beautiful, yet it is certain that almost any good man and any good woman can have happiness and a successful marriage if both are willing to pay the price." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "Love people, not things; use things, not people. " -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Silvana add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "The two most powerful warriors are patience and time." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Freethinkers are those who are willing to use their minds without prejudice and without fearing to understand things that clash with their own customs, privileges, or beliefs. This state of mind is not common, but it is essential for right thinking..." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If everyone fought for their own convictions there would be no war." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "In our old age my beloved companion said to me quietly one evening, "You have always given me wings to fly, and I have loved you for it." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "We are a noisy and blessed little family" -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Silvana add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens
